title.text: Integrated generation of graphics and text: a corpus study

abstractContent.text: We describe the results of a corpus study of more than 400 text excerpts that accompany graphics.

We show that text and graphics play complementary roles in transmitting information from the writer to the reader and derive some observations for the automatic generation of texts associated with graphics.

tableCaptions.text: Table 1: Counts of themes and intentions of messages in our corpus of 411 French texts; some texts  carry more than one intentions and theme
